images.title: Ian Taylor / Furzey Gardens: Thatched shelter
images.caption: Furzey Gardens, Thatched shelter. The table has a solid wood top, which must be about 5m long.

description: Enjoy a peaceful stroll around these beautiful gardens in Minstead in the New Forest. There are well laid out footpaths taking you through the gardens with Azaleas, Rhododendrons and woodland glades. Other highlights include the delightful 16th Century Cottage which you can explore, and a tranquil lake with a variety of plants and flowers around its borders. There are also viewpoints with views towards the Isle of Wight and New Forest. The Minstead Walk visits the gardens from the nearby village. It then goes on to visit the historic Rufus Stone just to the north east of the gardens.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: Only assistance dogs are allowed in Furzey Gardens.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The Acres Down Walk starts near Minstead. It visits the lovely Bolderwood Deer Sanctuary and the pretty streams and woodland of the Highland Water Inclosure. For more walking ideas in the area see the Hampshire Walks and New Forest Walks pages.
